title: Estádio Cidade de Barcelos
text:
The Estádio Cidade de Barcelos is a multi-use <a href="stadium">stadium</a> in <a href="Barcelos%2C%20Portugal">Barcelos</a>, <a href="Portugal">Portugal</a>. It is currently used mostly for <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> matches. It is the home of <a href="Primeira%20Liga">Primeira Liga</a> side <a href="Gil%20Vicente%20F.C.">Gil Vicente</a>.
The stadium is able to hold 12,504 people and was built in 2004. It opened on 30 May 2004. The inaugural game saw <a href="Gil%20Vicente%20F.C.">Gil Vicente</a> lose 2-1 to <a href="Uruguay">Uruguay</a>an side <a href="Club%20Nacional%20de%20Football">Nacional de Montevideo</a>. It replaced <a href="Estadio%20Adelino%20Ribeiro%20Novo">Estadio Adelino Ribeiro Novo</a> which was Gil's home ground from its establishment in the 1920s until 2004. The stadium is a <a href="UEFA">UEFA</a> Category C ground which allows for European and international games to be played there.
It held two matches of the <a href="2006%20UEFA%20European%20Under-21%20Football%20Championship">2006 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship</a>, <a href="Serbia%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Serbia & Montenegro</a> 0-1 <a href="Germany%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Germany</a> and <a href="Portugal%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Portugal</a> 0-2 <a href="Serbia%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Serbia & Montenegro</a>.
Portugal national football team.
The next <a href="Portugal%20national%20football%20team">national team</a> match was held in the stadium.
